segment.source: IAPs are published through the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: IAPs are published through the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: An IAP (in-app product) is a supplementary item for your app that can be purchased by customers.
segment.target: An IAP (in-app product) is a supplementary item for your app that can be purchased by customers.

segment.source: An IAP can be a fun new add-on feature, a new game level, or anything else you think will keep users engaged.
segment.target: An IAP can be a fun new add-on feature, a new game level, or anything else you think will keep users engaged.

segment.source: Not only are IAPs a great way to make money, but they help to drive customer interaction and engagement.
segment.target: Not only are IAPs a great way to make money, but they help to drive customer interaction and engagement.

segment.source: IAPs are published through the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: IAPs are published through the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: You'll also need to enable the IAPs in your app's code.
segment.target: You'll also need to enable the IAPs in your app's code.

segment.source: The first step in the IAP submission process is to create the IAP in the dashboard by defining its product ID.
segment.target: The first step in the IAP submission process is to create the IAP in the dashboard by defining its product ID.

segment.source: After that, you can create a submission so that your IAP can be purchased via the Windows Store.
segment.target: After that, you can create a submission so that your IAP can be purchased via the Windows Store.

segment.source: You can submit an IAP at the same time you submit your app, or you can work on it independently.
segment.target: You can submit an IAP at the same time you submit your app, or you can work on it independently.

segment.source: And you can make updates to IAPs after the app is in the Store without having to resubmit the app again.
segment.target: And you can make updates to IAPs after the app is in the Store without having to resubmit the app again.

segment.source: Here is the info that you can provide when creating your IAP submission.
segment.target: Here is the info that you can provide when creating your IAP submission.

segment.source: The items that you are required to provide are noted below.
segment.target: The items that you are required to provide are noted below.

segment.source: Some of these are optional, or have default values already provided that you can change as desired.
segment.target: Some of these are optional, or have default values already provided that you can change as desired.

segment.source: If Durable, a Product lifetime is required.
segment.target: If Durable, a Product lifetime is required.

segment.source: Optional (up to 10 keywords, 30 character limit each)
segment.target: Optional (up to 10 keywords, 30 character limit each)

segment.source: Default: available in all possible markets
segment.target: Default: available in all possible markets

segment.source: Default: IAP can be found by customers browsing or searching the Store
segment.target: Default: IAP can be found by customers browsing or searching the Store

segment.source: Default: Publish as soon as the IAP passes certification
segment.target: Default: Publish as soon as the IAP passes certification

segment.source: We recommend providing descriptions for every language your app supports.
segment.target: We recommend providing descriptions for every language your app supports.

segment.source: When you've finished entering this info, click Submit to the Store.
segment.target: When you've finished entering this info, click Submit to the Store.

segment.source: In most cases, the certification process takes about an hour.
segment.target: In most cases, the certification process takes about an hour.

segment.source: After that, your IAP will be published to the Store and ready for customers to purchase!
segment.target: After that, your IAP will be published to the Store and ready for customers to purchase!

segment.source: Note The IAP must also be implemented in your app's code.
segment.target: Note The IAP must also be implemented in your app's code.

segment.source: For more info, see Enable in-app product purchases
segment.target: For more info, see Enable in-app product purchases

segment.source: You can make changes to a published IAP at any time.
segment.target: You can make changes to a published IAP at any time.

segment.source: IAP changes are submitted and published independently of your app, so you generally don't need to update the entire app in order to make changes to an IAP such as updating its price or description.
segment.target: IAP changes are submitted and published independently of your app, so you generally don't need to update the entire app in order to make changes to an IAP such as updating its price or description.

segment.source: Important If your app is available to customers on Windows 8.x, you will need to create and publish a new app submission in order to make the IAP updates visible to those customers.
segment.target: Important If your app is available to customers on Windows 8.x, you will need to create and publish a new app submission in order to make the IAP updates visible to those customers.

segment.source: Similarly, if you add new IAPs to an app targeting Windows 8.x after the app has been published, you'll need to update your app's code to reference those IAPs, then resubmit the app.
segment.target: Similarly, if you add new IAPs to an app targeting Windows 8.x after the app has been published, you'll need to update your app's code to reference those IAPs, then resubmit the app.

segment.source: Otherwise, the new IAPs won't be visible to customers on Windows 8.x.
segment.target: Otherwise, the new IAPs won't be visible to customers on Windows 8.x.

segment.source: To submit updates, go to the IAP's page in your dashboard and click Update.
segment.target: To submit updates, go to the IAP's page in your dashboard and click Update.

segment.source: This will create a new submission for the IAP, using the info from your previous submission as a starting point.
segment.target: This will create a new submission for the IAP, using the info from your previous submission as a starting point.

segment.source: Change the info you'd like, and then click Submit to the Store.
segment.target: Change the info you'd like, and then click Submit to the Store.

segment.source: If you'd like to remove an IAP you've previously offered, you can do this by creating a new submission and changing the Distribution and visibility option to No longer available for purchase. Not displayed in your app's listing.
segment.target: If you'd like to remove an IAP you've previously offered, you can do this by creating a new submission and changing the Distribution and visibility option to No longer available for purchase. Not displayed in your app's listing.

segment.source: Be sure to update your app's code as needed to also remove references to the IAP.
segment.target: Be sure to update your app's code as needed to also remove references to the IAP.
